page.title: 17LYNE VILLAGE FETE
page.content: June. It is held on the Recreation Ground next to the Lyne Club in Lyne Lane. The fete starts with a procession of floats from Almners Priory led by a band or dance troupe. They travel along Almners Road and Lyne Lane to the Recreation Ground where they are judged. There are a variety of stalls and sideshows, refreshments in the Lyne Club and a tank provided by the army division from Longcross for the children to explore. Throughout the afternoon a Five-a-side football competition is held and displays of dancing and singing are carried out by the Village school and other local childrens clubs. The proceeds from the fete are divided between the church and the Lyne Club.
